subject: AI & Agents
title: Self-Regulation vs Government Oversight
description: A 60-second lesson on Self-Regulation vs Government Oversight.

hook.text: AI companies say 'trust us to self-regulate.' History suggests that rarely works.

buildup.text: Tech firms publish AI principles and form safety teams to self-police.

discovery.text: But when safety conflicts with profit, safety teams get sidelined or disbanded.

twist.text: OpenAI's safety team exodus in 2024 showed the tension between safety and commercial pressure.

climax.text: Most experts now agree that some government oversight is necessary alongside self-regulation.

punchline.text: The fox shouldn't guard the henhouse alone.

quiz.question: Why is self-regulation of AI considered insufficient?
options: Safety often loses when it conflicts with profit
Government has no role in technology
